com.inqwell.any

Class AnyLogFilter.FuncFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.inqwell.any.AnyLogFilter.FuncFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Filter
    Enclosing class:
    AnyLogFilter

    public static class AnyLogFilter.FuncFilter
extends Object
implements Filter
    An implementation of Filter that supports a log level and an Inq call statement to determine whether logging will take place.

    The level is used first to cheaply determine whether logging could take place. If it can (the level is ALL or the log record is at or above this filter's level) the Inq call statement is invoked. The Inq script can do anything it likes however its return value is converted to a boolean to decide whether the record will be logged. By default a Filter's level is Level.SEVERE.

    This functionality is intended to be used to add arbitrary processing on a log event, such as sending an email. The level (if any) would typically be a more severe value that that of the associated Handler or Logger, so that the Filter handles exceptional events. In such usage the Inq function would always return true, however it may veto normal logging of the record by returning false.

    Author:
    tom
